Author: Punk#1349
Content:
@Crabby Paddy Yes you can reuse a ledger address. The purpose of a different address  each time is to remain more private. Of course, when sending large amounts, 
I still send a small amount first to confirm the funds go into my wallet then I send the balance.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @Crabby Paddy if you are using the ledger claim it will send it to the new address. If you want to be on the safe side, open up the ledger app and check the new receive address it generates, then when you do the claim it should be sending it to the same address

Author: Crabby Paddy#6239
Content: Thanks @hyperDEX is that just a ‚Äúfor peace of mind‚Äù or has it happened to send to wrong address before for people?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Piece of mind for the paranoid

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Even if that page was hacked, the address generated should be 100% what ledger shows, you just need to make sure before confirming the tx that the address shown on the screen matches what you are confirming on the ledger

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: When Luke has some spare time, he will package the webpage so people can download it locally

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Then a hack of the website wont make any difference
